feats_optional_rules.title: Feats - Optional Rules
feats_optional_rules.tags: hero point feats called shot feats targeting feats words of power feats esoteric feats esoteric material component feats
description: ::mainheader[Hero Point Feats]{id=heropoints}
:::item
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/323}
The following feats enhance your ability to store and gain {rule/hero points}.
| Feat | Prerequisites | Description |
| {feat/Blood of Heroes} | Hero's Fortune. | Gain 2 hero points when leveling up. |
| {feat/Hero's Fortune} | | Gain a hero point and increase your maximum. |
| {feat/Luck of Heroes} | Hero's Fortune. | 25% chance to not spend a Hero Point when using one |
::mainheader[Called Shot Feats]{id=calledshot}
:::item
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/193}
Called Shot feats are used with [alternate rules](rule/called_shots).
| Feat | Prerequisites | Description |
| {feat/Greater Called Shot} | Int 13, {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Called Shot}, base attack bonus +6. | You can make multiple called shots per round |
| {feat/Improved Called Shot} | Int 13, {feat/Combat Expertise}. | Gain a bonus on attack rolls while making called shots |
::mainheader[Targeting Feats]{id=targeting}
:::item
{SOURCE Ranged Tactics Toolbox/8}

Several of the following feats have the new targeting type. If you are using the optional {rule/called shots/ rules}, attacks made with targeting feats count as called shots for the purposes of abilities or effects that modify called shots, such as the Improved Called Shot.
| Feat | Prerequisites | Description |

| {feat/Ace Disarm} | Dex 13, {feat/Deadly Aim}, {feat/Ranged Disarm} base attack bonus +6, weapon training class feature with a ranged weapon. | No penalty when using Ranged Disarm, make Steal attempts instead of Disarm at range |

| {feat/Ace Trip} | Dex 13, {feat/Deadly Aim}, {feat/Ranged Trip}, base attack bonus +6, weapon training class feature with a ranged weapon. | No penalty when using Ranged Trip, make special ranged trips against flying creatures |
| {feat/Ranged Disarm} | Dex 13, {feat/Deadly Aim}, base attack bonus +1. | Use a ranged weapon to disarm |
| {feat/Ranged Trip} | Dex 13, {feat/Deadly Aim}, base attack bonus +1. | Attempt a trip maneuver using a ranged weapon |
::mainheader[Words of Power Feats]{id=words}
:::item
{SOURCE Ultimate Magic/166}
Words of Power feats go with the [alternate rules](rule/words_of_power) involving words of power.
| Feat | Prerequisites | Description |
| {feat/Experimental Spellcaster} | Ability to cast spells. | Gain access to minor wordcasting |
| {feat/Extra Word} | Caster level 1st, ability to cast wordspells, see Special. | Gain additional effect words |
| {feat/Meta Word Mastery} | Ability to cast wordspells. | Gain additional uses of meta words per day |
::mainheader[Esoteric Feats]{id=esoteric}
:::item
{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/154}

In a campaign that uses the {rule/esoteric material component/ system>s}, characters have access to the following feats. Any time a character would gain a bonus metamagic feat, he can choose to take an esoteric feat instead. These feats have no prerequisites.
| Feat | Description |
| {feat/Esoteric Abjuration} | Your abjuration spells give the target a +1 competence bonus to a single saving throw for the duration of the spell |
| {feat/Esoteric Conjuration} | Your conjuration spells that summon creatures grant them partial concealment for 1 round |
| {feat/Esoteric Divination} | Your divination spells are more likely to give you information |
| {feat/Esoteric Enchantment} | Your enchantment spells inflict a penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, or skill checks |
| {feat/Esoteric Evocation} | Your evocation spells deal extra damage |
| {feat/Esoteric Illusion} | Your illusion spells are harder to disbelieve |
| {feat/Esoteric Necromancy} | Your necromancy spells cause their targets to be shaken |
| {feat/Esoteric Transmutation} | Your transmutation spells grant a bonus to physical abilities |
| {feat/Unstoppable Esotery} | Your spells that use esoteric material components are harder to stop or remove |

feats_versatile_brewing.title: Feats - Versatile Brewing
description: :::item
{SOURCE Potions and Poisons/16}

These feats allow potion brewers to concoct unusual variations in their potions, altering the potions' effects in strange and useful ways. These feats function similarly to metamagic feats, though they affect the creation of potions instead of the normal casting of spells. Level limits for potions apply to their level after the application of any relevant metamagic feats (if the feat affects the component spell's level).
| Feat | Prerequisites | Description |
| {feat/Delayed Potion} | {feat/Brew Potion}, caster level 5th. | You can delay the onset of potions you create |
